entry.title: New Phantom Stories • Re: Spoofs on Current Phantom Stories
entry.content:
daviedo wrote:

This right hand/left hand thing with the Two Rings must give the Phantom problems that Frodo Baggins never dreamed of.

Very appropriate spoof, considering the ongoing debate . Technically, the Phantom has to mark all evil doers with the mark. For that, he has to use his right fist. In case, he uses his head, or a stick or his feet or anything else to hit a baddie, the mark won't be there. Do you think that to fulfill the mark obligation, he will hit the guy again, even if he is unconscious?

Weighty points to ponder upon..

pcs

entry.title: Chatter • Re: Blake & Mortimer
entry.content:
Hallgeir wrote:

Timpa wrote:
PS - The Francis Blake Affair was the 1st fan-fic from '96,I wonder how much these deviated from the original theme/stories??

The new series is very true to the original in both time and theme. Even their arc enemy Olric pops up now and then. ( I don't know if he is called Olric in the english version. I've got the danish version.)

Hallgeir


Thanks for the input.I read in wiki that ol' readers were bit against the new plots,but if the stories are such good, will try my hand there aswell!!

Statistics: Posted by Timpa — Sat 11 Feb, 2012 4:26 pm

entry.title: Chatter • Re: Blake & Mortimer
entry.content:
Lothar wrote:

Me neither, until last week, when I received a recommendation from Amazon. As I’m a huge Tintin fan, this series looked promissing. Did a litte research and found that four of the Cinebook albums are available for download. Read The Yellow M first (http://www.mediafire.com/?mv1j3gk2luqmqi6). Quite enjoyed it but was not overwhelmed by it, at least not sufficiently to commit myself to the series. Then read the The Francis Blake Affair and with all the twists, cliffhangers and trying to identify the “mole” couldn’t put the book down (or rather the laptop down). Maybe because its a spy/thriller adventure (more to my liking) as opposed to The Yellow M that has this sci-fi vein to it. In an inpulse ordered four more books from Amazon. They don’t cost much, so even though the characters aren’t endearing as in Tintin, I don’t think I can go wrong.


Ditto!!Thanks for the review. I am a HUGE Tintin fan since my childhood,read the whole series in Bengali. So this was the reason I thought I will like this series too!And I am a big fan of both sci-fi & thrillers(one of the reasons why I'm so crazy about both Mandrake & Phantom,simultaneously),so I guess will like these titles..lesse!

Statistics: Posted by Timpa — Sat 11 Feb, 2012 4:22 pm

entry.title: New Phantom Stories • Re: D234: The Den of Tigers
entry.content:
Andreas wrote:

It may or may not have been clarified by Lee Falk, but in Team Fantomen's stories, the Skull Ring explicitly has a jagged edge that creates a scar, while the Good Mark ring is flat and works like a regular stamp, and needs some type of ink to leave a mark.

Well, I pointed out a discrepancy.. anywaz.. When a Phantom hits a baddie, he aims to leave a Mark.. which comes from his right fist. Here, he has used his left fist, so the baddie won't get the Mark. Whether or not he got a Mark, I leave it open for discussions..

pcs

Statistics: Posted by pcs — Sat 11 Feb, 2012 12:34 pm

entry.title: General Phantom Discussion • Re: My Phantom Costume.
entry.content:
I just used pic's from the movie as reference and just modified it. Glad you like it.
The skull's on the holsters were just samples. If i were to do another suit and holster it would be alot more accurate.

Statistics: Posted by max — Sat 11 Feb, 2012 11:54 am

entry.title: General Phantom Discussion • Re: My Phantom Costume.
entry.content:
Im With Capeto on this one Max, I think you did a great job also!

Btw how did you manage to put together all the patterns on the costume? Was it from photo references or something more detailed?

There is another member on here that has put together a costume based on the 96 film also, and from memory I think he actually contacted someone that may have worked on the costume for the film.

Statistics: Posted by MattMcG — Sat 11 Feb, 2012 10:22 am

entry.title: New Phantom Stories • Re: D234: The Den of Tigers
entry.content:
pcs wrote:

But when he hits someone with the left fist, there is no way that he can leave a Skull Mark. He will either leave a Good Mark, if the ring is facing up, or no mark, if the ring is facing down. And in the panel, drawn by Ryan, both rings were facing up...


I would vote for the good mark leaving no mark (save for a bruise) even if the good mark ring is facing up.

Like Hallgeir says, the good mark ring does not leave a mark in the same way as the skull ring. What use would the Phantom have for a good mark ring that leaves a mark only when you hit someone really hard with it?

It may or may not have been clarified by Lee Falk, but in Team Fantomen's stories, the Skull Ring explicitly has a jagged edge that creates a scar, while the Good Mark ring is flat and works like a regular stamp, and needs some type of ink to leave a mark.

Statistics: Posted by Andreas — Sat 11 Feb, 2012 8:54 am

entry.title: General Phantom Discussion • Re: My Phantom Costume.
entry.content:
Well, Max... as a fan of the movie costume (I thought it looked cool, with the "tattoos" and stuff, sue me) , I think you did a great job! the belt looks good too, except for the skull carved on the holsters... it looks goofy.

Other than that, excellent! You could fool me into thinking it's a real prop from the movie!

entry.title: New Phantom Stories • Re: D234: The Den of Tigers
entry.content:
pcs wrote:

pobox7 wrote:
I cannot find the story but i always thought the Phantom turned his good mark ring around the wrong way when he went into a fight

In The Masked Ball, it was stated that when the Phantom is not on a mission, he wears the Skull Ring in a reverse direction..


But there is no info on the Good Mark ring. Obviously, the Phantom is on a mission here.. so he will wear the Skull Ring right side up. But when he hits someone with the left fist, there is no way that he can leave a Skull Mark. He will either leave a Good Mark, if the ring is facing up, or no mark, if the ring is facing down. And in the panel, drawn by Ryan, both rings were facing up...

pcs


OK! What is the problem here?? Try to get a life someday PCS, outside your box (or was it panel)!!
